幻想水滸伝は3？だかのPS2で出ていたの1本しかやったことないです。
とりあえずクリア及び仲間を119人までは達成できたので更新、最後の一人はどうすっかな。
ゲームとしては楽しくないわけではないが、不便な点が多く継続してプレイするのがめんどくさくなっていく。
また戦闘周りは攻撃の集中であっさりやられすぎてノーマルですら難しく感じる、Xなどでハードおすすめをよく見たけど、そういう人たちってどう対処しているのかが気になりますね。

1.拠点の名前
用意されている中から数個がたぶんランダムで表示され、好みじゃなければ他のを選んで次の候補を表示していくが、
ランダムに表示されているせいで、めぼしいのが無いからさっき見たあれにしようとか思っても、なかなか出てくれなくて妥協してしまった、どうせなら手打ちさせてほしいが、せめて数個ずつ表示じゃなくて全部の候補が見れるような画面が欲しかったと思う。

2.バッグの容量
消耗品も装備もルーンも交易品も全部同じ枠なのに初期がたったの30がとても少なく感じる。
その場で装備変更すらできないルーンなど、共有の枠で扱うのにはとても邪魔でしょうがないし、
交易品もとある条件で必要になるまでは倉庫の肥やしになってしまう人が多いんじゃないだろうか。
また、後半になると素材袋が気づくと沢山入っていて、たまに拠点帰っているのになんでだとなるけど、木材や石材がすぐに溢れて素材袋からの自動移動が行われない為だった、あふれた分は自動売却なりの設定を追加してくれないかなとか思いました。

3.移動速度
ダッシュ速度が上がるアクセが序盤で手に入るが、前衛か後衛にいるキャラが装備していないと意味が無い為、
どれか1キャラクターは戦闘用のアクセを諦める必要が出て不便でしょうがない、せめて控えのキャラクターは対象としてほしかったし、途中主人公が切り替わってノア以外を操作する際も、外していなかったために通常の鈍足になって不便でしょうがなかった。

4.サポート枠
いろいろな効果があるものの、戦闘系は確実に発動してくれるわけでもない感じだからいまいち頼りにならず、バッグが増やせるようになったらそれを選び、アクセなしで移動速度を増やせるようになったらほとんどサポートを固定したままのプレイになってしまった、一人のサポートキャラに複数の効果を持たせるなどもう少し選択肢が広がればよかったなと思う。

5.エンカウント
テスト版では非常にエンカウントが多くてめんどくさく感じたものの、正式版になると今度はエンカウントが少なくなりすぎて、特定の敵を探すときなど無駄に時間がかかるようになってしまった、どうしてこうも極端なんだろうか、一応エンカウント率増加・減少のアクセも途中で手に入ります。(購入可)

6.戦闘
最大ＭＰに対して消費ＭＰが厳しく、結局単体回復はほとんどアイテムに頼る日々、だけど敵の攻撃が1キャラに集中することも多く、ＨＰをろくに増やせなかった序盤はその辺の雑魚戦でもあっさり1人落とされることも多くて復活薬がどんどん飛んで行った、後半になり多少はＨＰや防御増えてもタゲが集中するとあっさり溶けるし、硬いキャラはなぜか狙われずに最後まで残るし、睡眠や石化などはヒーラーを的確に行動不能にさせられて、とあるダンジョンで闇属性の全体食らったら、回復魔法持っていた3人がまとめて眠った時は大層驚きましたね、そして殴られると起きるけど、眠っているキャラクターが殴られた記憶がほとんどないんだけど、極力狙わないＡＩしてんの？

7.レベル上げ
パーティの前衛と後衛にいるキャラクターに経験値が入る、後々サポートと控えにも入るようになるのかな。
敵とのレベル差で獲得経験値が変わる為、レベルが低いキャラでもすぐに主力に追いつけるが、敵が強いからレベルをいっぱい上げて挑もうとか思っても、すぐにほとんど稼げなくなるため、開発の想定したであろうレベル帯付近で頑張るしかない。(1レベルに数十戦闘頑張れば一応上がる。)

8.アイテムの下取り
ショップで装備購入する際に、ステータス部分にだけ目を向けているとキャラクターが何を装備しているかわからない為、
おっステータス上がるじゃんと購入して付けた際に、思わずダッシュのアクセを売りそうになった、そもそも1個しか入手出来てないんだけど、そういう貴重品とか下取り聞かないでほしいなとちょっと思った。

9.戦争や一騎打ち
出来ることが無さ過ぎて、ほとんど正面からぶんなぐって眺めるだけの作業だと思った。

10.ミニゲーム
釣り：よくあるタイミングよくボタン押すやつ、竿の強化が出来てないと即逃げられる魚が居たりで面倒だったのに、白の強化が出来てないと竿の強化に関する項目すら見えなくてどうすりゃいいんだって気分だった
ベーゴマ：とりあえず強いのを敵から手に入れて投げればいいんやろ？近所の女の子に初期のベーゴマで手も足も出なくて絶望した、もう少し揃っていけば楽しめるようになるのかと思ったけど、ゲーム終盤で★3を3つ集めてあとは適当にやっているだけでだいたい勝てた、後は倒してない奴探すの大変なんだけど、ストーリーの途中で相手してたぶんと混ざって、どれが倒してないから見わけもつかない。
カードゲーム：新しいカードを手に入れられるようにする為の最初のバトルが厳しかった、運の問題もあるのだろうけど、敵は7～9ばかり出しているのに、こっちは最大で5,6あたりしか選べないターンが割と多くて、最初のバトル突破に7回だかかかった。その後はとにかく出しとけば問題ないキラカードが多くなってきたら適当に出しているだけでAやSも結構突破できている、スキルが充実していれば1が3つ並んでも勝てるときもあるから、ある程度カード手に入ってからが本番だね。
卵：卵孵化だけさせて全然触ってないな
船のレース：可もなく不可もなく
劇場：いろいろなパターン見れて面白い、ただし台本の入手が確率で出現するものを金払って手に入れなきゃいけないせいで、なかなか揃わないのが大変だった。
料理バトル：ランダムで出る審査員の好みがバラバラすぎて好みのものを狙っていくのが難しい、大体の審査員が平均的な数値を出してくれる料理がわかってきたら、後はそれを毎回出していた、ただ何人相手させられるんだよ、四天王が出てきてようやく終わりかと思いきや、四天王の間にも挟まって来るし、終わってもまだ知らないやつがまざってくるし、1戦毎に15分の待ちも発生するしでひたすらめんどうだった。

11.仲間探し
移動手段が不便なうちの行ったり来たりは行ける範囲が広がるとどんどんめんどくさくなったけど、
これに関しては途中から探しやすい手段も出てきたから良し。
一部見つけ辛いのとタイミングを逃したら次週に回すしか無さそうだから、全員そろったのを見るのは結構大変だね。

12.拠点の強化
他のことやっていれば勝手に素材や資金も溜まって行った為、急ぎで何かを建てたいとかじゃない限りは、気づけば進むので特に問題なし。

13.ゲストキャラクターの扱い
特定のダンジョンを攻略するのに一時的に加入しているキャラクターがいる際に、
アイテムが厳しいから一旦街に戻ろうと思うって外に出ると、どこに行くんだと言われるものの一旦出ることはできるが、
ゲストキャラクター自体はパーティから抜ける為、パーティの条件満たしてないって言われて強制でパーティ変更の画面が出てきて、すぐ戻るつもりだからそのまま決定して進めるものに、その辺の処理が遅いせいで、無駄に時間取られてイラついた。

13.実績関連
〇〇を全て見たいのコンプ系の実績が多数あるが、取り逃しの探索が大変なのと、各ミニゲームが演出などのタイムロスやら積み重なって全部やろうとするとすごい時間がかかる為、実績全部を目指す場合は100時間以上は覚悟した方がいいのではなかろうか。

14.その他
(1)とあるダンジョンでのこと、ボスが強いからギミックをこなして弱体化させてから戦おう→ギミックを攻略し終わり、さて回復とセーブしてからボス行くかと思いながら会話を眺めていたら強制で移動＆ボス戦開始とかなんの嫌がらせですかね・・・
(2)あるボス戦で始まる前に橋が完全に崩れたように見えたのに、ボス戦終わったら橋の向こうに居て、橋が崩れ始めて仲間と分断されていたけど、後ろに残された側ってほぼ橋残って無さそうだと思ったんだけど、あれはどういう状況だったんだろうか・・・
(3)ベーゴマ：スネークバイトの駒の絵がカクタスプレデターになっていた。
(4)鍛冶屋の武器強化、ほとんど使ってなかったキャラを使いたいときや実績解除目指したい時に、1レベルずつ上げるのが大変すぎる、いくつ上げるか選択してまとめてレベル上げ出来る機能が欲しいと思った。

[h1] 너무 안타까울정도로 많은것에 매몰된 고전JRPG의 꿈 [/h1]

[h3] 약한 스포일러 포함 [/h3]

사실 20시간 시점에선 10시간~12시간 지나고 마을간 텔레포트 얻고나면

그래도 여러 캐릭터 만나고 여러 지역 다니고 여러 조합도 시험해보고 JRPG로써의 그런 재미가 올라오려고 합니다. 초반의 그 지루한 구간에 대한 보상이라는듯이.


문제는... 그게 한 30시간쯤에 고점을 찍고 그 이후로 하락세를 탑니다.

이유가 여러가지 있는데

1. 미니게임
이 게임에는 미니게임들이 있습니다만... 좀 처참하게 재미없는게 많습니다
그나마 재밌는 쪽 - 카드게임
파볼만한 쪽 - 에그풋 레이스
처참한 쪽 - 낚시, 요리대결, 팽이

문제는 동료를 얻기위해 노가다를 뛰어야하는쪽은 처참한쪽의 요리대결과 팽이입니다.
카드게임도 노가다를 뛰어야하는데 이건 공략을 봐야 알수 있지만 정작 필요한 최소 카드게임 횟수는 2회[...]

그리고 결국은 좀 할만한 미니게임쪽도 이런 미니게임 제작에 힘쏟을 시간에 게임 전체를 신경써줬으면 어땠나 싶어지는 지점이 옵니다. 중간중간 보상도 별로 안좋구요.

요리대결은 진짜 처참한데, 에피타이저/메인/디저트를 고르고 45초의 요리시간이 주어지는데, 플레이어가 할것? A 연속으로 누르기 하나뿐입니다. 심지어 게이지를 다 채워도 강제로 요리시간을 봐야합니다.

그리고 심사? 동료로 들어온 캐릭 중 랜덤하게 4명이 나오는데, 문젠 모든 동료가 편식왕입니다. 자기가 싫어하면 무조건 0점주고 좋아하는 음식의 범위가 매우 좁습니다. 문젠 이러니까 요리계 최종보스가 등장했는데 0점과 4점의 대결이라는 매우 처참한 전개가 이뤄짐.

그리고 에피타이저/메인/디저트 순서는 아무 상관없습니다. 메인으로 사탕이 나와도 자기가 좋으면 만점이고 점수보정치는 전혀없고 애초에 상대방이 디저트로 카레 내놓고 난리남

[spoiler] 오믈렛과 코코넛주스가 그나마 좋아하는 범위가 넓어서 좋습니다. 근데 운나쁘면 싫어하는 그룹이 심사위원 될수도 있음. [/spoiler]

그래서 사실상 노가다가 될 수 밖에 없는데.. 요리대결할때마다 45초의 매우 지루한 A연타뿐...


팽이는 결국은 팽이 스펙빨 게임입니다. 상성이나 스킬운빨이 있다지만 결국 스펙높은 팽이를 구해서 (팽이를 구하는 방법도 몹 랜덤 드랍이라는것도 뭔가 참...) A연타하면 끝나는 게임입니다. 문젠 그 팽이를 구하려면 여러 몹들을 잡아야하고.. 이게 다음에 이어지는 비극으로 이어지는데


- 스토리 관련 부분이라 완전 스포일러는 안적었지만 전체 스포일러 처리-

2. 매우 유저를 엿먹이는것에 가깝고 뜬금없는 [spoiler] 진엔딩 조건 플래그 [/spoiler]

 [spoiler] 위에 말한 팽이랑 맞물려서 비극이 되어버렸는데, 진엔딩 조건은 "모든 동료 모으기"입니다. 그러니까 팽이를 구해서 팽이대전 이벤트를 해결해서 팽이동료를 구해야한다는건데 문젠 그걸 위해선 고렙 던전을 열어야하고 메인을 진행해야죠? 그리고 당연히 엔딩 직전에 돌아다닐 수 있으면 진엔딩 조건을 채울 수 있다고 생각하고 세이브파일을 덮어쓰게 됩니다. 그럼 망합니다. 정말로 정말로 유져가 전혀 알 수 없는 메인 스토리 진행 시점에 진엔딩 조건이 닫혀버립니다. 심지어 그렇게 닫혀버린 이후에도 동료구하기 퀘스트를 할 수 있기 때문에 더더욱 공략을 안본 유져는 헛짓거리를 하게 되는겁니다. 그러니까 공략을 안보고 이 게임 진엔딩을 볼라면 메인 하나 깨고 모든 마을을 돌아다니고 모든 npc에게 말을 걸라는건데 그냥 고전 JRPG처럼 공략보고 하라 그런 뜻인가 싶더군요. 그래서 모든 동료를 모으는게 어째서 진엔딩 조건이냐구요? 모든 동료가 나서서 뭔가 하는게 있냐구요? 아니요! 그냥 마지막 멤버가 중요한 행동을 하면서 가입하는 전개입니다. 마지막멤버는 그냥 모든 동료를 구해야만 들어오는거고 그 모든 전개에 이유와 관련과 개연성은 없습니다.. 

참고로 전 50시간 시점에서 동료 찾다가 못찾겠어서 공략보다가 진엔딩 데드라인보고 식겁해서 다행히도 남겨둔 5시간 전 세이브를 불러와서 다시 10시간 헛짓거리하고 진엔딩을 보고 이 리뷰를 적는겁니다. 진짜 그 세이브파일 안남겨놨으면 그냥 욕한줄 적고 비추천 리뷰로 바꾸고 끝냈을듯.

[/spoiler]




3. 이게임 재밌어 질라하는데...? 

30시간 시점에선 사실 플레이어는 희망찹니다. 어느정도 JRPG로써의 재미도 올라오고 동료도 늘어나고 심지어 여러파티를 운용하는 이벤트도 나와서 캐릭터 조합과 육성 찾아보는 재미가 생깁니다.

근데.. 그러고나면 어느새 최종전에 와있습니다.

어라? 


4. 열심히 구해봤자 결국 공기가 되는 동료들

메인 스토리 자동 가입 동료들이 아니라면 파티원일때 스토리 진행하면 가끔 한마디하는거 빼곤 그 이후의 서사는 존재하지 않습니다. 100명이 넘는 동료니까 그걸 하나하나 만드는건 불가능하다는건 알지만서도 결국 메인스토리 자동 가입 동료들이 아니면 정말 말을 가끔하니 매우 아쉽습니다.

그리고 자동가입동료들도 후반부에 들어온친구들은 결국 분량이 부족하고, 이미 키운 캐릭터들을 버리긴 애매해서 자연스럽게 본거지 청소요원이 되기마련입니다.

중간중간에 몇개 파티를 운용하는 이벤트가 있지만 그것도 매우 가끔있다보니 결국 한두파티 완성하는게 목적이 되버리고 정말로 많은 캐릭터들을 안써보고 엔딩을 볼 가능성이 높다는것도 큽니다.



결국을 게임을 엔딩을 본 시점에서 느껴지는게

킥스타터랑 기획단계에서 정말 많은걸 넣고 싶어했고 그런걸 차근차근 만들다가

결국 그걸 전부 완성시키기에는 물리적으로 불가능하단걸 깨닫고 게임의 규모를 줄이면서 게임의 길이가 뭔가 처음 기획한것보다 엄청나게 줄어든 셈인건데

문젠 그러면서 좀 더 보정하거나 적어도 좀 재밌거나 말이되게 만들 수 있는 부분들을

[b] 일단 게임을 발매시켜야 한다면서 "우리는 고전 JRPG를 만들겠다고 약속했으니까 불편한게 당연한거야" 하고 많은걸 방치하고 출시한게 아닌지? [/b] 라는 의심이 들 수 밖에 없게 되었습니다.


전 이 게임을 킥스타터 펀딩을 한 사람이고 그래도 꽤 기대하고 있었고 초반부 10시간까지 버티다가 아 이제 좀 재밌어지겠구나 하면서 어느정도 재밌게 즐겼습니다만

갑자기 하락세를 타기 시작하고 불합리한것들을 많이 겪고나서 엔딩을 보고나니... 그러한 행복회로적 팬심마저 전부 날아가버렸습니다.




진짜 고전 JRPG에서 게임 경험이 끊겨있고 다른 불편한 게임들에 익숙하다면 할만할지도..? 뭐 저도 결국은 엔딩을 본거니까요.

최신게임.. 아니 2000년대 이후 게임 하던사람들 입장에선 "게임이 나랑 싸우자고 하는건가?" 싶은 부분이 한두개가 아닐겁니다.


그래서 정가주고 게임사는건 절대 추천안하고 50% 미만일때 '나는 정말로 불편한 고전 JRPG여도 상관없다' 하면 사시는게 낫습니다. 



----- 엔딩을 보기 전 - 플탐 20시간 시점에 올렸던 리뷰 --------

좋은 의미로도 나쁜 의미로도 고전 JRPG... 연출도 사실 좀 최신해상도에 옛날느낌나는 뭔가 허전함이 있음[...] 패드 권장 게임이라고 표시되는데 일단 전 패드로 진행했습니다.

문젠 재미가 본격적으로 올라올라면 10~12시간은 해야한다는겁니다. 그 전에는 불편함만 가득한 무언가라는것[....]

Review:

Edit after beating the game and sinking in a considerable amount of time:

TLDR: 
It's a decent spiritual successor to Suikoden 2, definetely enjoyable, but doesn't hold a candle to the former in many aspects, while also inheriting many of its flaws that could have been improved or directly reworked in this game, instead of focusing in other aspects that barely add to the game experience. That being said, it was fun to play all the same and it's not a bad game by any means, plus many of its current issues can be addressed with minor tweaks.

I'd rate it with a solid 8/10.
--
I'll go more in-deep about some of the game aspects below until hitting char limit, don't read if you want to avoid possible spoilers. Will also use Suikoden 2 as comparison, since it's clearly the game Eiyuden took the inspiration from. So:

[h2] Story [/h2]

It's decent, but very predictable and with a pacing/progression that doesn't feel organic in many moments. This leads to the access of certain systems feeling rushed, like the castle acquisition. Won't spoil much, but, for instance, in suikoden 2 the castle comes across completely as a neat and unsuspected surprise after beating Neclord's spawn, whereas in Eiyuden it's more like: oh you beat these thieves, cool, here's your castle. 

Other than that, it was entertaining for the most part.

[h2] Localization [/h2]

Like many other posters commented, the english translation from the original japanese falls quite short, turning casual dialogues into borderline childish lines. I wasn't bothered that much about it as you can just ignore it, but if you know a bit of japanese you can tell right away that the translation doesn't add up.

[h2] Combat [/h2]

[h3] System [/h3] 
Turn based, 6 char party, you choose all character actions before engaging into the turn itself, same as Suikoden II. The UI now contains a bar displaying the order of actions that will take place within the turn, and this order changes as you select the actions per character. That's great, however, because you are planning in advance the 6 actions of your party, which are mixed with the enemy actions, because the order in which actions are selected for your party doesn't match the turn action order, and because you can't see what action you chose per character, it's actually hard to track what choices you selected within the turn. It'd have been great to be able to see what choices were taken per character by providing an option to review the turn or through visual hints.

[h3] Battle feeling/fun [/h3] Combat is fun at first but unless you are constantly changing the team compo it eventually turns very repetitive, leading to auto most of the fights beside bosses, which for the biggest part, have some special interaction or gimmick as they call it in-game. That's cool although I feel they made gimmicks way too strong, to the point you can beat bosses by having one party member doing the gimmick and having the rest of the team defending and healing all time, especially in the first bosses. The gimmicks are not present in all bosses later on but they are still too relevant. 

Something I liked is that in this game you have support characters in your team that can trigger certain effects at the start of the battle, like giving 1SP to the party, boosting stats, etc

[h3] Magic [/h3]

In Eiyuden they replaced the rune charges system from Suikoden 2 in favour of mp usage. This is not necessarily a bad thing, however, offensive magic in the early stages of the game is incredibly underwhelming and there are no efficient means to restore mp until way ahead, to the point its only worth using support magic throughout a big part of the game (heals, buffs, etc.) while relyng on skills to inflict damage. Magic then becomes broken in late game as you now have characters which hit really hard with magic and get access to spells that make your whole party invulnerable 1 turn and you can cast these several times per turn. This gets worse once you get access to high level rune shards, which allow casting these broken spells all time, through which you can cheese any fatal blows.
All in all, the old rune charge system would have been better, as i feel it's easier to balance in the early/late stages of the game, while also forcing players to make better judgements about when certain spells needs to be used.

[h3] Combos [/h3]

Cool looking but currently useless except for very few combinations. I read somewhere that combo multipliers are currently bugged, resulting in less damage the more members participate in it, which would explain why the damage output is so low. As of now, it's not worth changing the party just to access a certain combo. Leaving damage aside, there's a wide variety of combos, incentivizing trying out different party compositions.

[h3] Field battle [/h3]
Same vibes as Suikoden 2 but in 3D. Wish squad leaders had had their own model instead of being a generic unit model, but not that big of a deal. The fights could have been a bit faster though, they felt quite slow.

[h2] Minigames [/h2]

I feel they put a lot of effort into them instead of focusing on other aspects of the game. It'd also have been nice that minigames had an impact on story progression or benefited you in any way in that regard, but they are completely standalone miscellania activites, like in Suikoden II for the most part. 

- Egg race: Cool minigame, clearly unique on its own, but rewards very meh. Loved the race casting voice acting though, lot of effort put there.
- Theater: Same as egg race, cool, with an astonishing amount of voice lines, dialogues, and custom sprites per character. As with egg race, no reason to try out all combinations other tha n for fun (which is the point too to these minigames, ngl)
- Fishing: Too simple
- Cooking contest: A pain in the ass in all possible ways, specially when you need to go through all the contests to unlock a star character. Giving no option to skip the 45 sec long animation at the start of every contest was one of the few things that I hated from the game.
Also, dishes scores didn't make any sense at all, the judges will almost always give bad scores regardless of your dishes choice, leaving the minigame completely up to rng whims. In the end I found an almost always winning combination [spoiler] Miso - Omelette - Fried egg [/spoiler]
- Hotsprings/Onsen: Provides a buff to the party after soaking in. Same as Suikoden 2.
- Beyblade: It's ok, but it sucks that you dont get access to decent ones until quite late. The chain of quests to get the star characters is also not very intuitive, as you need to beat first certain competitors before the ones that mke you progress through the quest chain show up.
- Card game: The idea itself is not bad and its midly enjoyable once you have a deck, too bad the pace feels very rushed, you go from nada to full deck in a given time of the story.
- BossRush: Should be postgame. Unbalanced

[h3] World / Visuals [/h3]

Nice 3D scenarios with an interesting mix of visuals and camera perspective changes as you move through places. Liked the 1vs1 cutscenes a lot. The world map itself feels a bit empty though and there's really no reason to explore it. Nice character sprites and spell sfxs, which are quite contained, not too flashy, not too dim, there's a good balance.

[h3] Bugs [/h3]

There are quite a few bugs that need to be polished. To me though, the dialogue bubbles getting stuck in endless waits and the frequency/fps leading characters to skip frames/compress animations were the big ones.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]Évolution après quelques heures :[/h2]

[b]Gameplay old school:[/b] On a ici droit à une version old school des JRPG, du bon vieux tour par tour, quelque peu remis au goût du jour cela dit. L'équipe qui était en charge de Suikoden améliore une recette qui fonctionnait déjà à l'époque pour faire d'Eiyuden Chronicle un digne successeur de son aînée. On peut cependant noter quelques choix étranges dans l'équilibrage des personnages et de la magie, qui est globalement en deçà de ce que peuvent accomplir les personnages "physiques".

[b]Exploration agréable :[/b] Les décors sont variés et possèdent un certain charme. Ce mélange de 3D et de 2D fait son petit effet, et si on note quelques textures baveuses - peut-être un bug ? - l'ensemble est agréable à parcourir. Mention spéciale pour les arènes de combat qui sont vraiment réussies ainsi que les sprites des personnages.

[b]Profondeur narrative :[/b] L'histoire nous plonge dans la peau de Nowa, et contrairement au jeu de la série Suikoden, celui-ci est doté d'une voix (comme tout le casting du jeu) et d'une personnalité qui lui est propre. Quelques choix sont à faire mais jamais sans grande importance. Le récit prend du temps à se mettre en place et conte une épopée sans grand retournement de situation mais tout de même efficace.

[b]Optimisation et bug :[/b] L'optimisation est bonne, le jeu promet de tourner sur un maximum de configurations. À noter tout de même que les écrans larges ne sont pas pris en compte et que les bonnes vieilles barres noires accompagneront votre aventure à moins de modifier les fichiers du jeu. On regrettera quelques petits bugs ici et là, le plus gênant étant celui qui demande de bloquer les hertz de son écran sous peine de ne pas générer de combat aléatoire.

[hr][/hr]

[h3]Verdict TLDR :[/h3]

Eiyuden Chronicle offre un gameplay JRPG old school revisité avec un tour par tour amélioré par l'équipe de Suikoden. L'exploration est plaisante malgré quelques petits bugs graphiques. La profondeur narrative est présente avec un protagoniste bien défini, bien que l'histoire manque de retournements majeurs. L'optimisation est correcte, mais des problèmes avec les écrans larges et quelques bugs mineurs persistent. On aurait apprécié quelques semaines de finition supplémentaire.
Good old school games!

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is the final work of Suikoden creator Yoshitaka Murayama who passed away earlier this year, and it's a love letter to fans of the classic series. It was a promised beginning to explore a path that has largely been the road not taken by games since, probably due to the scope and ambition that it entails. While he may not have lived to see its release, he would have been nothing but proud of the end result. You should take the time and check out Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes, and when you're done, look into Suikoden if you enjoyed your time. 

It’s not perfect, there are flaws, relics of another time and oddities in places, but it's a soulful work with an excellent tale, engaging characters, a rich world and strong gameplay. It’s easy sometimes to miss the forest for trees when reviewing a game, to get caught up in smaller problems that detract from the game, but it's important not to get lost here, and take in the view of it all as a remarkably cohesive, thoughtful and fun whole. 

Final Score: 4/5

Update: I’ve spent *a lot* more time with this game. Most games play their entire hand at the start. Refreshingly, like the days of old, this is a game you need to commit to before you get to enjoy it. I’d even argue the first 15 hours are a slog, especially if you’re exploring the systems. 

However it means the game gets so much better with every hour beyond that. The game hides QoL behind gameplay features which you unlock in the mid-game. Upgrading your castle feels so important because of it, unlocking new rooms and shops almost feels like a skill/progression tree.

Not to mention the sheer variety and volume in recruitable allies (my advice? Play with a guide for the first 15 hours, or at least until you unlock the diviner who is like a vague in-game wiki). The combat options also open up with allies, and an appreciated amount of unique runes and combos. So yes, the combat isn’t all an auto slog the entire time. It’s even kind of fun to grind again, with so many ways to get gold, and a generous exp share formula for weak allies.

This game is almost twice as fun now that I’m further in. It could even be my RPG of the year if it keeps up the momentum it has earned. The castle has so many layers to the upgrade, anything but superficial or shallow like so many modern day games.

Initial review:

This isn’t “Suikoden but for the modern day” - it’s just Suikoden, dated flaws and all. So expect some pretty awful QoL and combat balancing, as well as very obscure questing and exploration.

The first few hours are a slog and I’m sure many people will refund during it. However, the game picks up once you get to your first real dungeon: the abandoned mine, after a recruitment run in the first open map area.

In my opinion, it definitely isn’t up to current standards of what a game should offer and how polished it is, but that never stopped us loving the game it’s openly based on. So if you can look past that and temper your expectations, then you’ll get a lot of comfy nostalgic feelings playing this game.

You’ll resort to using ‘auto’ in most random encounters as even on hard, every enemy dies in two basic attacks. However the boss fights are when the game really shines and the combat system can be appreciated.

Been keeping myself from getting spoiled on all the recruitable characters, but even of the ones I’ve met so far, they’re a fantastic bunch of likeable, quirky and eclectic teammates with some stellar voice work to tie it all together.

This is a very tentative recommendation, in fact I almost came close to not recommending it just to prevent disappointment, but thankfully most reviewers agree on the game’s shortcomings.

Current score is a 5 out of 10, but we’ll see how feel by the end of the game where I’ll update my review.

10/10.

The opening to the game is quite slow, it feels like something is missing, and then the drop happens.
Like with previous works from the now late writer, Murayama, this game taps to a pre-established beat.
It is hard for me to not compare it to the old Suikoden games, as will be the case with many I am sure, however it did something unexpected for me.  It has reestablished my love of this genre.  Things that were done in the past were repeated in this game, but the designers also ramped it all up to 11 and left me with my jaw dropped in surprise and excitement.

It has been such a very long time since I experienced a sense of sheer 'squee' from a game.  They always try so hard to make you feel sad, or angry, but this one like previous of its creators handiwork leaves me instilled with a grand sense of wonder and joy.

Though the narrative is about war, it doesn't focus on the negatives and the brutality that other games would, and instead it feels almost like a journey that you would experience from playing something like dungeons and dragons for example:  Your characters are mostly fresh to the world (as are you when you start the game for the first time), and from there you start to explore your surroundings, learn the way of the world, and find your place in it to defend and protect what is important to you/the characters.

There are some parts that feel a bit too drawn out, I'll give it that, but at the same time the end result is worth the lengths you have to go.  Whether it be uncovering something astonishing, or a big plot point that you hadn't expected so soon!
(Sorry trying not to spoil it for others! You'll see when you get there!)

The lighting is a bit intense in places, or design choices (such as putting blue shapes on a blue background) aren't the best, however the aesthetics, the soundscape, the music, the story, the animations, the copious amounts of cats, the overall ambience and feel of every part of the game you can tell the creators put their souls into them to make something to the very best of their abilities.

Some may say some of the system choices may seem dated by today's standards, however I honestly don't think they are.
The bag for example forces you to engage with your inventory.  You can't just be a hoarder and expect to pick every little thing up.  You need to be wise and choose things appropriately - that or you can just walk back, inventory dump, and then return for the rest of the chests if it's that important to you to open them.

For what it is worth, this game has ticked every single box I had hoped it would, and then some!
I will sing this games praises for years to come, because to me, it is a fun and enjoyable game that has done what it promised it would: It took me on an adventure, fed me nostalgia, and showed me a new story that I never would have been able to dream of.

I truly wish there to be a second of this games title some time in the future, and though it won't be the same without Murayama who's stories shaped my childhood all the way through to my adulthood, the rest of the amazing people he worked with for a very long time are more than skilled enough to continue on the legacy he helped create.
Very much looking forward to the studio's future endeavours! 

Thank you for all your hard work and for giving a good smile, Rabbit & Bear Studios!
Best of luck to you!

Absolutely hooked on this love letter to classic JRPGs.  If you've played the Suikoden series, you know a lot of what to expect here, being created and designed by key members of that original Konami team.

ゲームを起動すると何故か「全てのJRPGファンへ」という英文が出てくる濃度100%のJRPG。
現状UIの遅延や不便な要素が多いので改善されてから購入した方がいい。

[h1]長所[/h1]
・仲間の数が多い
本作の最も特徴的な部分と言えばやはりこれ。
どのキャラも魅力的で全員に声優を起用する程気合が入っている。
本作のスピンオフ作品の開発が決定したというが、自分が好きなキャラが出るのであれば是非とも買いたい。

・強制加入メンバーを控えに回せる
好きなキャラでパーティを組める。更に主人公も控えに回せる。

・忠実なJRPG
宿屋に泊まると暗転と共に謎のジングルが流れる。
会話中は頻繁にキャラの頭上に「！」が出てくる等、JRPGには欠かせない謎のお約束が盛りだくさん。

・バッカーの名前がゲームに出てくる
クラウドファンディングで資金を募ったゲームなのでバッカーの名前やバッカーが考えたであろう拠点の名前等がゲームに登場する様が面白い。
特に面白いのが戦争のミニゲームで、戦っている最中に戦死者が出るとバッカーの名前が出てくるのだが明らかにウケを狙ったようなふざけた名前が出たり、基本ランダムなのか同じ人物が何度も戦死して大変シュールである。

・人外が多い
ゲーム序盤からパーティメンバーにイケふさな人がいる。
しっかり仲間を集めていれば人外だけでパーティが組める。
ユニコーンをオカズにしている海外ニキでも遊びやすい　※個人の感想です


[h1]短所[/h1]
・令和のゲームとは思えない程不便過ぎる要素が多い

1.装備品の一部であるルーンは町に行かないと変えられない。ダンジョンで技を増やすルーンを拾ったとしてもすぐには使えない。
しかもルーン屋はどの町にでもある訳ではない。

2.パーティメンバーの入れ替えも宿屋か拠点でしか行えない。サポートメンバーに特定の人物を入れればセーブポイントで編成できるが、サポート枠という貴重な枠を使ってやっと普通のRPGと同じ利便性になるくらいなら編成はデフォルトで付けておけ。
控えメンバーは3人まで置いておけるのだが、宿屋で編成しなければ戦闘メンバーとの交代すら出来ないのは不自然。一緒に行動してるんじゃないのか？

3.移動速度を上げる方法が貴重なアクセサリー枠。
これを装備する事を前提に敢えて通常の移動速度を遅くするくらいなら常にこの速度で移動させて？
移動中にキャンセルボタンを押すと主人公を歩かせる事ができるが、歩きなんて使わないからキャンセルボタンを移動速度アップにして移動速度上昇アクセを撤廃した方がいいとは思わなかったのか。

4.融通の利かない作戦
回復アイテムの使用を許可していると回復量100の薬草を持っていても回復量10の料理を使って瀕死の味方を助けようとしてしまう。

5.オートセーブが不便
オートセーブのタイミングが限定的過ぎて殆ど役に立たない。
数十分にも渡るイベントの最中には一度もオートセーブもしてくれない。ちょっとした空き時間にメインストーリーを進めるのはリスキー。

・ゲームバランスが色々おかしい
1.防御の影響があまりにも大きすぎる
防御の計算式が現代ではあまり見ないような単純な引き算なので、同じ攻撃を喰らって1ダメージで済むキャラと60ダメージ受けるキャラが出てしまう。
そんなバランスなのでタンク系キャラでパーティを組んだ途端難易度が急激に下がる。

2.キャラのバランスも色々とおかしい
キャラ毎に攻撃の射程が異なり、 S < M < L　の3種。当然射程の短いSのキャラ攻撃力が高いのがゲームとして理にかなっている筈だが本作はその限りではない。
射程がLなのに全ての性能が破格のキャラがいる。
それとは真逆に射程Sで魔法が一切使えない脳筋なのに魔法使い以下の物理攻撃力のキャラが居たり、射程Sは前衛に配置しないと攻撃が届かないというのに防御が低めのキャラが多かったり何かと不遇。

3.魔法が不遇
MPの燃費が悪すぎてダンジョン攻略中に使用するとボス戦までに枯渇する。
攻撃魔法の威力も消費に見合わないものばかりで、ボス戦では攻撃力を上げるバフを掛けて物理で殴った方が遥かに効率が良い。

・戦闘中やUIのテンポが悪すぎる
メニューの切り替えに謎の間がある。
戦闘のテンポは本当に悪い。逃走に成功したメッセージを約3秒間見せる意味とは？
他のゲームが何故倍速機能を付けているのかよく考えた方がいい。

・ミニゲームの中で頭一つ抜けてクソなものがある
戦争と一騎打ちがあまりにもつまらない＆ゲームのテンポが悪いので事実上クソゲー。
どちらにも共通して言えることは、戦略性もないのに無駄に演出が長い。
寄り道ではなくメインストーリーで発生するので避けようがない。これ自体をスキップさせる機能を追加して欲しい。

・パッドでプレイしてもマウスカーソルが消えない
マウスカーソルも仲間の一人なのかも知れない。

[h1]総評[/h1]
[h1]JRPGというワードを免罪符にあらゆるシステムを不便にするのはやめませんか？[/h1]

プレイヤーを苛立たせる要素が多いがゲーム自体はつまらなくないので一応親指は立てておく。
特にキャラの個性と数は際立っているので、事前に情報を仕入れて気に入ったキャラが居たら購入するのもアリかも知れない（全員が戦闘に出せる訳ではないが）

I love this game, I have tried many JRPG games (none of the suikoden games) and this is in my top 3 ever.
I am a sucker for having a lot of stuff to do like mini games and feel like like the world is alive, I just wish the world was bigger and it got more places to go to.
People mostly making a fuss over translation, is just laughable in my opinion.

I really want to like Eiyuden Chronicle and recommend it, because on the surface this is a Suikoden sequel in all but name. But also its 2024, where is the Suikoden vibes, gameplay mechanics, and pacing, but with QoL features and a better UI than what we got? So much of this game is confusing, even coming from a background of having played Suikoden 1 - 4. So many things also don't work, Eiyuden is really buggy and broken. For example, the cooking contests; you can only win them with two different recipes and that's it, use anything else and the judges will rate your meals a 0/10. The PC version has a broken frame rate that is tied to your encounter rate, so if you play above 60fps, you'll just never get a random enemy encounter. There is also a bug that will prevent you from getting a recruit as well which can lock you out of getting some endings. 

Then there is the god awful english localization, and how bored the english voice actors all sound when delivering their lines. 

The combat animations are great at least! The combat is a joy to watch, and R&B Studios really nailed this aspect of the game. Its the one thing that took what looked and worked great with Suikoden and improved upon it, even if everything else is outdated. Balance though can feel completely out of whack, and some mechanics are pointless or make no sense. There is front and back lines for your characters. Some characters cant fight or do certain attacks if they are behind the other characters in your party. This is fine on paper! But the game never tells you about this, you just have to experiment and hope you get it right, and then remember who can be placed where. 

There is no saving anywhere you want. Come on now, this is a gigantic RPG releasing in 2024, there is no excuse for this. Especially since you'll have long stretches of story followed by multiple combat encounters, and you won't be able to save. In one instance the Inn was right there, but an NPC prevented me from going over to it to save. I had to just continue on and hope for the best, when all I really wanted to do at that point was take a break from playing. 

The rest of the game though just feels lifeless and devoid of any personality. 

Pacing can be really bad and a huge chore. You will be backtracking a lot because new recruits become available to find in previous locations as you advance through the story. And you have to be careful with this because some of them could become unavailable later on. So you're kinda forced to do all of this backtracking.

Inventory space is also very limited, and items can only stack a few times. Like healing herbs can be in stacks of 6 only, and then take up another inventory slot. Later on you get expanded inventory though, but its still a huge inconvenience for no reason until you get there. Why even have limited inventory space to begin with if you're going to just arbitrarily expand it later on anyways? 

I really want to recommend this game a lot, but its held back, and is missing so many Quality of Life features, and has a lot of outdated design, that it's a really tough game to enjoy. I love Suikoden, but I was hoping we would be getting that experience in something a bit more modern, not to mention vastly more polished then what we got.

与时代脱节的游戏，设计理念几乎都是2000年初的设计：暗雷，背包限制，杂兵战冗长动画也不能加速和跳过，不能即时存档，操作也不便利，跑步加速还是个饰品，你不带跑步简直是龟爬，符文还不能随时换，看角色个人状态还要把人编入队伍。很多便利的功能倒不是没做，只是柔和进同伴和基地建设里面逐步解锁，比如快速移动，板凳经验等等，甚至小游戏也要挨个解锁，这样就会让初期游戏很枯燥乏味，当你可以建设基地和四处拉拢同伴时候游戏才会显得好玩起来，不过也只是相对不枯燥而已。难道这游戏没有优点吗，那肯定是有的，可控人物多的一比，还都是设计过的，有数不清的合体技。小游戏也多：打牌，赛马，战斗陀螺，钓鱼等等应有尽有。如果没玩过古早JRPG建议不要尝试了，因为他的慢热会让你在功能没解锁完毕之前浇灭你的热情

我买的豪华版，提前2天就可以开始玩了。看我游戏时长就知道了，我请了两天假，打了25个小时……算是够支持你们了吧？
————————
先说好的方面：和幻想水浒传本传一样味道的剧情。这个是值得肯定的。虽然换个说法，就是有点偷懒，其实就把前面几个幻水的剧情换个皮凑合在一起。小游戏很丰富，战场模式等等， 还是原来的味道。作为日式回合制RPG，战斗手感也还不错。

然后，我看了一下其他人的回复，我给大家打个预防针：1、主角移动速度确实慢，但是有加速鞋，目测加速50%以上。后面有一个支援角色，效果是移动速度翻倍。2、这个游戏是有快速移动的。你剧情到了【水车之城】（防剧透）的时候，能遇到一个瞬间移动NPC，她入队后就可以瞬间移动了。
————————
然后，是坏的方面：
1、我难以想象，这都什么年代了，还有游戏不支持自定义键位？！制作组，你们是真的觉得回车确定，退格取消是个很舒服的键位吗？UO控制左右翻页，你自己把手放在键盘上自己看看舒服吗？菜单是T，系统菜单是Y，最应该是系统菜单的esc在这个游戏里毫无意义？！我玩了这么久，大概也猜到了，你们肯定是先做了主机板，然后顺势移植到PC的，我相信这游戏的手柄体验一定不错，但键盘体验就是灾难……

2、汉化是糟糕中的糟糕。如果只是机翻+润色，读起来不通顺也就算了。关键是，很多NPC会找我要东西……他们要的东西，跟物品栏里的东西是不一样的名字！！！我进度不够快，目前发现了这么多：NPC要【保护符文】=护甲符文，要【火花石】=闪亮石，要【导流符文】=激流符文。如果您游玩的时候，发现NPC要的东西你没听说过，不要着急，你先回忆回忆，自己有没有名字差不多的东西。还有一些很搞笑的对话……祐介：我的名字叫勇介。←你到底叫什么？

3、然后，是游戏最糟糕的问题……遇敌率。你以为我要说遇敌率太高？错了，是遇敌率太低。前期有许多需要你刷怪练级刷钱的需求，你不刷怪，没钱买药，没等级打boss，如果你跟我一样走普通难度，那么你会发BOSS异常难打，因为遇敌率太低了，你很可能跑完了整个迷宫才打3、4仗，经验不够导致了你等级比boss低很多……而且还有许多需要你刷掉落的任务。比如，游戏里有个陀螺小游戏，陀螺哪来的？刷怪掉落的。还有一些队友，入队条件是让你刷3头野猪啊，或者是刷掉落的闪亮石啊什么的……
PS：达到中期，饰品店可以买引魔香，一定一定【不要买】！因为马上你就会从沙漠地图里捡到一个。这玩意售价我记得是3W块，完全不值得。这是装饰品，不用买。如果你跟我一样，想要全收集，建议你装上。不然刷怪会刷到你头疼……

4、愚蠢至极的收集系统。游戏里的【素材】道具，比如铁矿石什么的。当你进入自己的基底时，这些东西会自动进入你的基底仓库，不能再拿出来了。举个例子，有个矮人NPC，需要10个铁矿石入队。我基地里有三四十块，不行。他不认。我也没办法拿出来，为了收矮人，我必须去矿点，再蹲10块铁矿石出来……为什么？你们之前做的那个外传，你们知道仓库里的东西可以直接交给NPC完成任务，怎么本传就不行了呢？

5、为什么，不支持自定义名字，这不是从初代就开始自定义名字的吗？……你说，因为是全语音，所以主角有个默认名比较有代入感，好，我接受。那么，为什么基地的名字也不让我自己输入？只能给我3个选项，让我刷你们起的默认名字库？！反正你不让我起主角的名字，干脆基地你也替我起了得了。

但，我不会退款，我等幻想水浒传的续作太久了。但，如果您跟我不一样，您不是幻想水浒传的死忠粉……那么，我建议您，多等一等，看看别人评测，或者，等等打折。它的诸多问题，目前配不上这个价位。——如果您真的想体验，我个人建议您，至少等到汉化程度优化一下。

As a backer, I got early access to this game and therefore won't be mentioning bugs as I'll give them time to work on them and also, none of them are gamebreaking. Just a bit frustrating. 

Starting with the negatives, so with that said, let me start with the elephant in the room - the localisation. It's not great. But it's not some "woke" dumpster fire, it's nothing that deep, it just feels like a poor and dated attempt at humour that, frankly, doesn't land very well. Sometimes it takes away from the story, as an otherwise strong or dark moment is interrupted with a joke that doesn't exist in the original script, or in some cases the vibes of a character are different. But it's not some catastrophically, objectively game ruining woke nonsense as some reviews elsewhere make it out to be. It's just... not great, and the story would definitely have benefited from a different approach there. As well as the localisation, there's definitely some more objective problems with the game functionally - some of the menu's are a bit laggy, and some of the systems aren't very well explained and I feel I only understand them since I have a long history with JRPGs, and the Suikoden series in general. I can see how they would be frustrating to a complete newcomer, similar to some of the older mechanics implemented. Although a welcome addition in my opinion they run the risk of definitely feeling a bit dated or frustrating to newer players, or even to other longer time ones. And finally, the war battles feel NEEDLESSLY long. I understand they are different games but they feel much longer yet somehow less exciting than those of the Suikoden series. 

But honestly, these are all things I've been able to look past (although the localisation has been a struggle to ignore at some parts, gotta be honest) because the overall product has been so thoroughly and genuinely enjoyable. I am a hardcore fan of Suikoden 2 and the Suikoden series in general, but rather than making me biased towards the game, it gave me higher standards for what I expected from the team, and they definitely delivered.
The game is beautiful, the music has been gorgeous, I thoroughly enjoy most of the characters, and I find the minigames and side activities to be really fun. I'm 43 hours in at the time of writing this and feel as though I've only just scratched the surface of the story with all the time I've spent doing side content because it really does just feel fun.
From what I've seen so far of the story though, despite a slower start and when it's not being interrupted by questionable localisation/translation choices, it's a very solid story that I've enjoyed going through so far.
The base building systems are really enjoyable, the areas and dungeons have been fun and at some points definitely challenging, and overall there has been a significant step up in difficulty from the Suikoden series which is entirely welcomed. 

In general, this experience has been a pretty significantly positive one. It's delivered nostalgia in a modern package, in a way that doesn't feel stale, dated, or overdone. It really has delivered almost exactly what I expected from the team behind it, and has been by far and away enjoyable enough to look past any of the negatives and continue to thoroughly enjoy the time spent.

I picked up a copy on Steam so I can have it for Steam Deck eventually and to support the company, but I've got around 50+ hours on the PS4 copy that I received as a backer. Writing a quick review here for those curious about whether or not this game is for them. 
- If you are a long-time Suikoden fan, then this game definitely scratches that itch and feels like the Suikoden VI that we never got. 
- If you like turn-based JRPGs generally, then you will enjoy this. There's a lot of personality and charm to the game and its core systems and minigames. 
- If you like games with base building, then you're in for a treat.

Suikoden and its creator, Yoshitaka Murayama, are two of the big reasons why I work in game development today. I always hoped to work with, or at least, meet Mr. Murayama, and I was deeply saddened that he recently passed away far too young. Rabbit & Bear Studio have indicated that they'd like to keep the world of Eiyuden Chronicle, his last gaming gift to us, going, and I hope they can. With that in mind, if you fall into any of the categories I listed above, then this game is well-worth supporting now. You'll have a good time with it, and it'll help us get us sequels that keep Muryama's spirit alive. 

If you are looking to buy the game, it's worth noting that there's a Metroidvania prequel called Eiyuden Chronicle Rising that is worth picking up as well. The game's a fun appetizer, introduces you to the setting and a number of characters you'll see in Hundred Heroes, and there's a save import feature that unlocks unique Rising items in Hundred Heroes for you. 

Have fun, all, and best of luck to the team at Rabbit & Bear!

O jogo atendeu as expectativas para mim como apoiador, é um ótimo jogo, está me prendendo com a história e etc! Segue um estilo e fórmula de JRPG clássico de PS1/PS2 com algumas melhorias atuais de gráfico e jogabilidade melhorada. 

É basicamente o retorno de "Suikoden", que tanto esperamos, pelas mãos de suas mentes criativas, fora das asas da empresa que pelo menos até agora parece ter arquivado a IP sem novos lançamentos faz um bom tempo.

É um "sucessor + raiz" comparado com Suikoden III, IV e V, que  segue a fórmula quase à risca, e como a série anterior não é totalmente faraônico - como as franquias mais famosas - a não ser o número de personagens jogáveis... quem conhece sabe, fantasia medieval com intriga politica e guerra numa forma que muitas vezes pode ser leve, bonitinha e muitas vezes, dura e tocante, no velho estilo junto e misturado dos JRPGs que tanto amamos. 

Nostalgia pura para mim, acho. (Suikoden II é o jogo que eu mais finalizei e eu não sou o tipo de jogar mais de duas vezes, imagina você tipo aos 15 anos de idade, com como recrutar personagens quase de cabeça.)  

Se você curte um tipo de tranquilo de jogo com alguma profundidade, o jogo é perfeito pra você. (Obrigado por tudo, Yoshitaka Murayama, seu legado seguirá!)

Maaas... falando aqui no Dia 1, você encontrará alguns bugs e claramente alguns problemas de texto - nada que nós brasileiros não estejamos acostumados em relação à RPGs asiáticos no geral, né, haha, tenho até um exemplo meio tosco que é, se você joga em inglês e nomeia tua base "Arcadia", que pô, nome dahora, em inglês e espanhol vira "Castelo Naranja/Laranja", sem zoa, me senti até o Diretor Clavell, haha) - mas em si, vale a pena principalmente pra você que jogava Suikoden e também pra você que curte o estilo e não conhece. VAI FUNDO, RAIOS! XD

Tomara que corrijam esses problemas mais pra frente - tipo o timing de uma cena que que tem uma quebra com um trilha e trava a fala parecendo que é um bug gigante ou o problema de recrutar x personagem aí - que aí fica o famigerado 10/10 pra mim, sou um homem simples de gostos simples. Aliás, qual outro jogo faz sentido e fica legal um canguru de tapa-olho, uma samurai e um pedaço de pau e mais outros três personagens diferentes enfrentando inimigos de gostos duvidosos né? :B (Sem contar que o design de ambientes e lugares no jogo é bem mais criativo que dos Suikoden antigos, apesar de eu preferir o estilo pixel art que era o charme deles.)

Pessoal estrangeiro reclamando por causa da tradução é de cair o ** da bunda, que tempos vivemos... sério, o único problema é um alinhamento ou coisa gramatical e os caras veem pelo em ovo, é muito chato! Não liguem pra eles, sigam seus corações, heróis! 

Boa aventura! :D

One day, 505 Games was celebrating their Kickstarter success with Bloodstained: Ritual of the Night. Shortly afterward, they looked at Octopath Traveler and thought two things: “Hey, that looks nice but I think we can do that better” and “I remember Suikoden and I wonder if we can hire some of the original Suikoden staff and make our own Suikoden game.” And that’s how Eiyuden Chronicle was conceived. 

And it’s been very well conceived. A huge cast of 100+ characters, voiceovers, and animations? And in a turn-based RPG? Balancing for a 6-party team? Furthermore building a separate war battle and duel functions along with several minigames? And at the same time making the game look great and sound incredible? That’s a team that is really sticking their necks out to revive Suikoden, and no other studio in the world would ever dare to sign off on it. 

The fact that the game is actually good despite the above risks is its own feat.

I haven’t finished the game yet, but I’m currectly 50 hrs in, including some of the minigames. I think this game is a solid 8/10. There’s a few choices that I think are questionable mechanically, but the Rabbit & Bear studio has wildly succeeded in making a good template to passing off the torch from Suikoden and I trust the studio with continuing with this series.

Das Spiel ist ähnlich wie Octopath, hat aber in meinen Augen auch deutliche Unterschiede. Ob es nun besser oder schlechter ist liegt im Auge des Betrachters ;-)

Ich finde den einstieg in das Spiel sehr gut erklärt und das anfangs etwas unübersichtlich wirkende Menü ist schnell erlernt.

Grafik: Der Grafik Stil ist wie bei Octopath ich nenne es mal 2D+ (2DHD oder wie das heißt). An manchen stellen wirkt die Grafik etwas schwammig, wobei ich das Gefühl hatte es war an vielen Orten so gewollt. Trotzdem muss ich sagen die Grafik ist sehr gut und ich gebe dem ganzen 4/5, weil ich nicht glaube das manche stellen so schwammig sein sollten. :-)

Sound: Das Spiel hat eine sehr gute Sprachausgabe, die Stimmen passen zu den Chars und die Japanische Sprachausgabe hat sogar viele bekannte Anime synchro Stars ;-) Die Musik ist sehr Abenteuerlich wie man es von solchen Spielen kennt. Ich gebe dem Sound volle Punkte 5/5

Umfang: Das Spiel wirkt von der Karte her "noch" nicht so groß, aber wenn man sich überlegt das es 120 Helden zum rekrutieren gibt und ich erst 10 oder 11 gesehen habe, glaube ich es wird schon 50-100h füllen um alles zu erkunden :-) (keine Bewertung, da es Leute gibt die eher kurze Spiele bevorzugen)

Spiel Spaß: Wer die Art an Spielen mag wird sich vermutlich verlieben, die Story ist gut geschrieben und macht Lust auf mehr. Allerdings habe ich auch erst 6h hinter mir weshalb ich das noch nicht vollens bewerten kann :-) Bisher würde ich sagen 5/5 (hängt aber auch mit der Spielmechanik zusammen, ob man solche Spiele mag oder nicht.)

Abschließend nochmal meine Wertungen:
Grafik: 4/5 (für die Art von Grafik)
Sound: 5/5
Spiel Spaß: 5/5 (wenn man die Spielmechanik mag)

Bugs. Lots of bugs. The Kickstarter promised backers beta testing, but all they really got was a game demo instead. This game could have used actual beta testing to work out all of the horrible bugs. There are currently 200+ bugs listed by players on the official Discord that could have been fixed before release had there been an actual beta. 

Yetee Productions handled the Kickstarter rewards distribution. That decision has resulted in a massive mismanagement ranging from people getting the game days and even weeks after launch to nearly all of the extras people paid for not even having a date for when they will receive them. Switch physical users had to be sent digital codes because they have no idea when their physical copies will actually be sent. Steam physical backers got a slip of paper in a box with a code. Many Playstation backers got their physical copies over 1 week before everyone else. The entire thing was just a mess, just like Rising was.

So, how is the game? Localisation is weird at times, but didn't throw me completely off. Voice Acting is a little cringe at times as well, but again that didn't throw me off. My biggest complaint is that it didn't try to be different at all. It's a re-skin of Suikoden 2. That's it. Just a poorly disguised re-skin of a great JRPG from the PS1 era. I mean an almost perfect re-skin too, right down to the inept teleporter girl and the annoying sister to the protagonist. The game is decent because it literally copies a good game in every aspect. No attempt was made to come up with new characters or new stories. Just copy and paste with the names changed.

As a Steam Curator I must say: Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes will make you smile from beginning to end if you're a passionate Suikoden fan that understands that the two supports one another, rather than fight each other for the spot. 

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is a miracle of a game that many wouldn't even hope to have in 2024. Its roots are very traditional and therefore are scattered in the overall project, for the better or worse. It is undeniabale that the Suikoden series serve as a major inspiration for this game, but while the two are very similar to one another, they are also very distinct. 

While the duo of main protagonists look a lot like the duo of Suikoden 2 and have similar ideals, their dynamic is completely different from the very start and are completely thrown off when a third protagonist gets thrown in the mix, and that's where the game designs its base lines, putting the whole project on a different take of the Suikoden series while still tapping in when needed.

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes features a fantastic turn-based 6 party members combat system with over 100+ characters to recruit and use in all the various sub systems that the game have to offer. The player will find themselves doing all bunch of different stuff with all different characters, ranging from serious tone like tactical war to really silly stuff like playing some kind of beyblade game. 

While the game is all but perfect and could use more attention to detail, the ground is really stable and it makes me enthusiast for the future. 

Lots of bugfix and quality of life additions are needed, and some balance changes like making Hard Mode harder and Normal Mode easier, but other than that, Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes has so much to offer that the player will feel immediately thrown in the world when playing. 

About translation issues, it's not that big of a deal than most people make it, and most importantly is that R&B is aware because ultimately it's their choice. If R&B feels like the translation is fine, then that's their choice, and it means that everything translated is very well conveyed for worldwide to experience the story of Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes. 

100+ recruitable heroes to feel represented by, 6 party members battles, Headquarter system with various sub systems attached to it, lots of mini games, tactical wars, duels...  Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes offers so much that you can find in many other games but NEVER together in one. If I only stop to think that incoming patches will make the whole experience even better...

I'm already waiting for a Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes 2, basically!

Did you like Suikoden? If no, you probably won't enjoy this. But if you like the following:
100(+?) recruitable heroes
6-character combat system (not a typical 3 or 4 characters like other RPG's)
Castle/base building (in stages, not free-flowing, this isn't minecraft)
(Mostly linear) Exploration (that was the style back in the day)
Army battles (!)
1v1 duels (!)
Characters with depth and funny dialogue
If you like aaaaaaaall that stuff wrapped into a JRPG, then I am pretty sure you will love this game!

Seriously, don't listen to the haters. This game has depth, I'm over 30 hours in and still enjoying it, I'm taking my time with it, and slowly digesting it. 

I encourage you to do the same. This is a masterpiece in its own, and it's not perfect, but it scratches my Suikoden itch better than anything else has in my adult life. I legit feel like a kid again with this game.

[h1]Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes Review[/h1]
Tras el lanzamiento de una precuela/spin off metroidvania no tan imperdible, Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising, por fin ha llegado el momento que los amantes de los JRPG clásicos han estado esperando, es decir, el lanzamiento de Hundred Heroes. Desde el momento en que se anunció, quedó claro que Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes representaría lo que Murayama habría querido seguir haciendo con el mundo de Suikoden si no hubiera dejado de trabajar con Konami, todo transportado naturalmente a un nuevo universo de juego y un entorno original.

Como ya hemos visto en la fase de preestreno, Eiyuden puede definirse a todos los efectos como un nuevo “Suikoden”, pero no debemos caer en la trampa de pensar demasiado en esta marca altisonante del pasado, porque estamos ante un título que vive con su propia dignidad y personalidad claras. Por supuesto, el estilo y la fórmula son siempre los mismos, pero el punto no es tanto la marca, sino su creador. Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes es un JRPG clásico, con exploración a lo largo de ciudades, mapas de palabras y mazmorras, todo aderezado con combates estratégicos por turnos.

La primera misión de Nowa y su nuevo grupo de compañeros será acompañar a la expedición imperial liderada por el joven Seign durante la búsqueda de una lente en bruto, cuyo descubrimiento dará inicio a la historia de nuestra aventura. Por mucho que algunos de los pasos de la trama puedan parecer bastante falsos, después de las primeras horas de juego, no queremos quitarnos el placer de descubrir todo lo que te espera, pero sabemos que el nivel de escritura no traiciona las expectativas: juegos de poder, traiciones, cambios de frente, protagonistas obligados a tomar decisiones difíciles, intrigas políticas y dramas personales, aunque no faltan situaciones ligeras y cierto tono desenfadado que nos recuerda a la corta edad de muchos de los protagonistas principales, basta pensar que al principio de la historia vemos a una Nowa de diecisiete años.

El elenco ilimitado es increíblemente polifacético, pero al mismo tiempo coherente consigo mismo y con el espíritu del juego y aunque no todos los personajes pueden presumir de un trasfondo profundo, a veces incluso unas pocas líneas de texto son suficientes para enmarcar una personalidad o encariñarse con uno de nuestros protagonistas. 

En esto también ayudan las maravillosas obras de arte que acompañan a cada uno de ellos y que embellecen los gráficos que, para ser sinceros, aparece de inmediato como el principal talón de aquiles de Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes, con un estilo en “2.5 dimensiones” donde en entornos 3D de inspiración bastante fluctuante se mueven discretos personajes bidimensionales, pero ciertamente mejorables, así como se podría mejorar el sistema elegido para aumentar la sensación de profundidad de los entornos, que explota los desenfoques y las líneas de horizonte fijas que son honestamente evitables y desagradables a la vista. Si ya hemos aclarado los puntos relacionados con la calidad de la trama y el sector técnico, queda hablar de la jugabilidad, ya que te acompañará durante muchas horas dependiendo de cuánto quieras diseccionar el mundo creado por Murayama. 

Las fases exploratorias se dividen desde el mapamundi hasta zonas de interés como ciudades, con habitantes y tiendas de diversa índole, y mazmorras. Si las ciudades no nos impresionaron especialmente, con las estructuras internas a menudo gestionadas por activos repetidos, las dunas muestran una buena inspiración e interesantes opciones de diseño entre carreteras secundarias y rompecabezas ambientales que no siempre son obvios. Por supuesto, gran parte de la jugabilidad se basa en el combate, estrictamente por turnos y contra enemigos no visibles en el mapa, pero que aparecen con una frecuencia bien manejada y nunca exasperante. 

Con nosotros podrán venir nueve personajes divididos entre tres que lucharán en primera línea, tres en el segundo y tres en apoyo, dándonos unas habilidades especiales que pueden hacer las cosas más fáciles de lo esperado. Eso sí, las habilidades específicas de cada protagonista los harán más o menos adecuados para un puesto, por lo que tendremos que tener en cuenta factores como los puntos de vida, la resistencia, el rango de ataque y las habilidades especiales. No hace falta decir que habrá una gran variedad de opciones entre tanques, hábiles a distancia, magos de ataque, magos de apoyo y más, con el elenco mostrando una buena diferenciación, hasta el punto de que también habrá diferentes comandos de defensa relacionados con cada personaje: algunos esquivarán, otros cobrarán, otros podrán recibir golpes cargando para ser aún más efectivos en el próximo turno, creando un sistema de combate extremadamente táctico y en capas.

Al comienzo de la batalla veremos en la parte superior de la pantalla el orden de acción de todos los contendientes y así podremos planificar nuestros movimientos. Tendremos que elegir qué hacer hacer a todos nuestros personajes razonando sobre las posibles elecciones de enemigos, quizás centrando todos nuestros golpes en el enemigo más poderoso o en el que nos atacará primero, para eliminarlo antes de que pueda hacernos daño. Por supuesto, no faltan movimientos de varios tipos y cuanto más subamos de nivel, más podremos insertar runas mágicas en nuestras lentes, para ganar habilidades. Además de los clásicos puntos de vida, tendremos puntos mágicos, que solo se pueden recuperar con objetos especiales o descansando, y SP, que en cambio se recargan a medida que pasan los turnos.

No faltan las batallas contra jefes, cada una con sus propias peculiaridades. A menudo podremos aprovechar acciones relacionadas con la ambientación, como escondernos detrás de los escombros para evitar un ataque o utilizar algún elemento del campo de batalla a nuestro favor. Todo lo que hemos hablado contribuye a que los combates sean bastante estratégicos, aunque el nivel de dificultad normal es muy fácil y ver la palabra “game over” es bastante raro. Puedes aumentar la dificultad, pero incluso entonces con un poco de molienda podrás llevarte a casa la victoria, siempre y cuando tengas una fiesta equilibrada y bien pensada.

[h3]Conclusión[/h3]
Eiyuden Chronicle es un gran juego aunque no perfecto en su falta de voluntad para aprovechar alguna solución de juego que hubiera hecho que la experiencia fuera un poco más ágil, además de algunos clichés que hoy en día se ven demasiadas veces. En cualquier caso, recomiendemos Eiyuden Chronicle sin reservas a todos los jugadores que aprecian los JRPG. La atmósfera, la trama, la música y la jugabilidad son los puntos fuertes que te guiarán en la línea de un videojuego que merece ser jugado de una sola vez.

[h3] 現状のままでは、幻水ファン以外にはオススメは出来ない [/h3]

幻想水滸伝は外伝含めて全てプレイ済み。
そんな、自分含めたファンが待ちに待った幻想水滸伝シリーズの精神的続編の本作。

仲間集めの楽しさや、ミニゲームの多さ、世界観の作り込みなどはこのゲームの特筆すべき点だと思う。

しかし、現状ではそれを覆い尽くしてしまうストレス要素がプレイを億劫なものにしてくる。
とりあえず極力ネタバレにならない範囲で書き殴ってみよう。

■システムやストーリー進行における、あらゆる点でのテンポの悪さ

・メニュー画面で仲間の回復後毎に生じる謎の間。
・ボス戦にギミックがあるのは結構だが、何回も同じ演出を見せられる上にカットできない。
・ダンジョンを少し進むごとに生じる、主人公一行のフルボイスリアクション。右下のワイプで処理して？


■ユーザー目線になりきれていない、散見される不親切さ

・仲間を強化する要素が多いが、それらは一々施設からアクセスしなければならない。
特に序盤の鍛冶屋等は特定の街にしか無いので、機会を逃すと当分利用ができない。
またルーン屋に関しても、正直購入以外は倉庫から付け替えしたほうが便利等、
システム的に練りきれていない感が透けて見える。

・持ち歩けるアイテム個数に制限を掛けるバッグシステム。
消費アイテム、装備品、ルーン（強化アイテム）全てひっくるめて、持ち歩ける個数は30個（拡張要素あり）まで。
特にその場で付け替え出来ないルーンとかバッグにあっても邪魔でしか無い。
これは幻想らしさとして継続したシステムなのだろうが、正直令和のゲームで
こんなカビ臭い要素は必要ない。こんなものなくても幻想らしさは十分出せている。
せめてポケ◯ンみたいに、アイテムのカテゴリ毎に管理させてほしい。

・MP消費魔法の燃費が悪い。ホイミ枠がMPを10も消費するおかげで、主人公達は道中ずっと薬草を齧ることになる。
そういった回復アイテムのウエイトが高いゲームデザインと、上記のバッグシステムの相性が劣悪。
大量に回復アイテムを持ち込んだ結果、ダンジョンで拾ったものを諦めるか、持ち込んだ回復アイテムを捨てるかを
ダンジョンを抜けるまで延々と選ばされる。


■演出面での不備

・主人公三人の声がこもっている。おそらく収録時期や環境が他のキャラクターと異なっているのだろうか。
結構気になるレベルで違いが聞き取れてしまうので、没入感を損なう要因になっている。

・戦闘中のカメラワークが酷い。戦闘中にカメラがフラフラあっち行ったりこっち行ったり…
おかげで後衛キャラクターの被弾が見えない場面がやたらと多い。
音を聞いていないと、見えないところで戦死者が出ているなんてことも。
正直これはもう即刻修正すべき箇所だと思うし、テスターから要望は上がらなかったのか疑問。

・町やダンジョンでは主人公より奥にはブラー処理（ぼかし）が掛かるが、掛かり方がキツすぎて、純粋に視界が悪い。
特にダンジョンギミックを解く上ではデメリットにしかなっていない。


他にも純粋に使いづらいUIやマップ、痒いところに手が届かないオプション、
味方より素早く、的確に後衛を蹂躙してくる飛行系の雑魚等、やってて少しずつ精神が削られていく感覚がある。

また従来の幻水シリーズでは、戦闘面等の難易度はかなりライト層を意識して作られていたと思うが（3を除く）
本作ではそういった配慮もあまり見られず、割と全体的に殺意が高い。
なのでシステム的な古臭さは感じるものの、遊んでいても不思議と幻想水滸伝をプレイしている感覚にはならない。
（この辺が幻水との差別化点として意図してデザインされたものだとしたら、自分は好意的に評価したいとは思う）
この辺は、何に期待してプレイするかで評価が別れる所だろうか。

決して面白くないわけではない。ましてクソゲーなどでは断じて無い。
ただ、今や神格化された幻想水滸伝2に引っ張られすぎたがゆえに
現代向けにアップデートできていない点も目立つ、そんな作品だと感じた。

note : 

The game is fine , the major issue is the localization / the translation . I am speaking as someone who has at least O-Level Japanese comprehension and has compared 30 minutes scripts between Chinese , English and Japanese . The English translation is simply not up to the standard. 

The translation is handled by team with background of DEI activist , likely undergraduate and hired based on sexual orientation .  Not only the translation is handled very poorly , with little accuracy and not following the original material , it is downright disrespectful to the original writers . 

Hence , there is a 7 pages of " translation code of ethics " handbook held within the translation team , as discovered by some avid Suikoden Fans . The handbook clearly stated that you must [b] DELIBERATELY insert gender politics , LGBT and racial influence[/b] in the game , [u][b]despite the original game did not mention any of it[/b][/u] . According to the handbook , it is ... for the greater goods of the " modern western audience " . 

An eg of how this translates into the game : 
During a post boss battle scene , a char was talking about how impressive the boss fight was (in both Chinese and Japanese translation ). But in the English translation , it was completely changed into a char questioning the Gender Identity of the boss. How absurd and rude is this to its original writer and dev from Japan ?!

This is not just a botched job  , it is a textbook example of modern extremist shoving politics down at gamers throat . It is an indoctrination , a corruption of creativity , an exploit of gamers enthusiasm. If you are half of the gamer you think you are  , avoid this like a plague . 

I have already put in more than 2 hours , so I can't refund this . But you can make a difference today , stop buying games like this , stop supporting game translators that has no respect for the source material .

As someone who has played the original Suikoden 1 , 2 , 3 , ( Nanami plot twist was so memorable I still remember the game fondly ) , it pains me to write this review but it has to be done.

P/S : On top of translation issue , the game is currently littered with a Game breaking bug , where if you have a very high refresh rate monitor your encounter rate would drop so significantly to the point you would not encounter any fights ( hence stop gaining lvls from exp ) on a 240hz refresh rate monitors .  As of the time of writing this bug is yet to be fixed .

[h1]我々が待ち望んでいた幻想水滸伝は[/h1]
[h1]もう二度と帰ってくることはない[/h1]

私は生粋の幻水ファンです
キャラクター、音楽、ストーリー、演出
数あるRPGの中において全てが超高水準だった幻想水滸伝1.2を手掛けていた村山氏と
幻水を作り上げてきたスタッフが制作したこの百英雄伝
なるべく事前情報は仕入れずプレイしてみましたが、、、

[h1]残念だったところ[/h1]
■100人を超える仲間たちの雑調整
実際に戦闘に参加させられるキャラはそこまで多くないが
ほとんどのキャラが使いどころのないキャラクターばかり。
どれもこれも同じような性能をもったモブキャラたちと
明らかに性能が飛びぬけているキャラとの差が激し過ぎる

ステータスは高いけど装備できるレンズが少ない
装備できるレンズは多いけどスキルレベルが低い、、、etc
このゲームはそこら辺のバランスを考えて作られていない
SPもMPも使わずPT全体の火力を二倍にするとか何を考えているんだろう
お前のことだよダイクストラ

■音楽に関しては雰囲気だけなら幻水だが、、、
一番最初の村の音楽はとても良かったですがそれ以降まったく耳に残らない
幻水２の音楽なら何十年たった今でも８割ぐらい覚えてるのに
こちらの作品だと１時間前に効いた村の音楽ですら耳に残らないレベル

■主人公としての魅力　キャラクター達の魅力の無さ
対した成果を出したわけでもない主人公が反乱軍のリーダーに選ばれ慕われ
早い段階で拠点の城を手に入れたりとそこに至るまでのカタルシスもない
幻水の様な特別な紋章を身に宿しているわけでもないので強さの裏付けもない
ただ心優しいおせっかいなだけのキャラなので魅力もない

■対して盛り上がらないストーリーと演出
基本的な流れはいつもの幻想水滸伝なのだが
なぜかイマイチ盛り上がらない平坦なストーリー
幻水２のような主人公とジョウイみたいな
「守りたいものは一緒なはずなのに
　見てきたものや環境の違いですれ違ってしまう」
みたいなものを作りたかったのか知らないが
二回あっただけの同年代の男の子とすれ違った所で、、、
それもすぐに和解するしで安っぽいストーリー

味方が応援に駆けつけてくれるシーンも盛り上がらない
多分これは音楽の力とキャラクターの魅力の無さが原因だと思われる

■100人以上いる味方の大半がモブ顔
ドットでのキャラ表示はすごくいいのに
会話やキャラクター表示時の立ち絵が本当にひどい
絵の上手な高校生にでも書かせたのだろうか？

[h1]男の娘ってのはなぁ、、、[/h1]
[h1]見た目は女、声も女、でも中身は男が素晴らしいんだァ[/h1]
モモのあれはなんだ？オカマボイスの男の娘とか正気か？

カリオストロちゃんを百回見て出直してきてください

■ボイスボリュームがバラバラ
収録環境がバラバラだったのか分からないが
声が異常にこもっている人、声が小さい人、声がデカい人
スピーカーならあまり気にならないが
ヘッドホンなどをしていると声の大きさが明確に分かる
もう少しボリュームの調整ぐらいしてください、、、

■レスポンスの遅さ
PS時代のゲームをそのまま持ってきたようなレスポンス速度にビックリ
戦闘行動一つ一つの遅さ
メニュー画面のタブ切り替えの遅さ
街やフィールドを駆け回る移動速度の遅さ
グラフィックを綺麗にしただけのPS１をやっているようだ

■ミニゲームのすべてがつまらない
料理対決とかいう1分近く連打するだけのゲーム
ベーゴマとかいう数秒に一回ボタンを押すだけのゲーム
釣りとかいう数秒に一回ボタンを押すだけのゲーム
レースとかいうただ眺めているだけのゲーム、、、etc
そして前述したようにこのゲームは何をするにも動作が遅い
つまらないものを延々と見せられる苦行
そしてそれらはトロフィーの獲得に影響する為
トロコンを目指している人は苦痛を強いられることとなる

■敵とのエンカウントがとにかく発生しない
他のゲームと比べてその5分の1ぐらいしかエンカウントしない為
ちょこっとレベリングしたいと思っても敵と遭遇しない為捗らない
一応中盤辺りから装備でエンカウント率を操作できるようにはなるが
それなら最初からある程度エンカウントさせろと言いたい

■おまかせ戦闘(オート戦闘)
FF12の様な状況に合わせて行動させる、、、
ように見せかけて実際はMPを使う、使わないぐらいしか組めない
実質息をしていないクソ仕様

■MP消費が正気じゃないほどコスパが悪い
回復も攻撃も全体魔法を使ったらすぐにMPゼロになってしまう
もともと幻水は回数制限だった為それに合わせたのか分からないが
これなら回数制限のままでも別によかったじゃんと思う

[h1]良いところ[/h1]
■中盤辺りからダンジョン以外からならファストトラベル可能
以前の幻水ではビッキーを通してでしかファストできませんでしたが
今作ではマップを開いていつでもどこでも飛べるようになった

■演劇が面白い
登場人物たちを好きな配役で演劇に参加させることができるミニゲーム(？)
ある程度声優さんを知っている人ならば
あの声優さんががこんな演技を、、、なんて笑ってしまうシーンも多々
いい意味でふざけた演出となっている

[h1]終わり(^^)/[/h1]

私は勝手に幻水2のような神作品を期待してしまっていたが
よくよく考えたら3以降の幻想水滸伝はお世辞にもおもしろくなかった
ベースは幻想水滸伝とはいえ
音楽もキャラクターもストーリーも演出も
幻想水滸伝を超えることはできなかった

それでも私は幻水のファンなので次回作に期待です

为小时候的幻想水浒传情怀买单

游戏内容说实话还不如星穹铁道，音乐画面就更不如了。。。

不过里面的一些角色塑造还不错，全角色语音也是好评点，值得一玩

最后吐槽下jrpg真是贵，同品质的逸剑风云决才多少钱？
Best Suikoden Ever.

So far, fantastic. Yes the localisation is abit off at times, but it does not take away from the game itself, actually find it quite entertaining. The nostalgia of proper turn based JRPG and the Suikoden influence is all over the game, so far everything I had hoped the game would be.
反派的声音太愉悦了。
幻水 1 2 3 百年交至 黄道轮回 通关玩家表示 爽就完事了 但要把老太婆无法入队的bug修了 。玩的不爽觉得别扭对老式JJRPG有偏见的小鬼爬 你们不是受众。兔子熊的爹是微软 不差你们那点B销量。

The game was great for me, overall i like it.

1. Story 10/10 : Its give Suikoden 2 vibe, its a bit less dark than the Suikoden 2, but not too different.
2. Character 10/10 : Most of the character was good, all of them have their own loveable quirk. 
Based for my own opinion, Nowa, Seign, and Lian felt like Riou, Jowy, and Nanami relationship. [spoiler] Nowa and Seign are best friend like Riou and Jowy, and Lian, despite not a sibling like Riou and Nanami, but Lian teased Nowa a lot, like how Nanami teased Riou back in Suikoden 2. [/spoiler]
3. Translation 5/10 : Its because lots of adding some new word/sentence or translated it into a completely different word. But its not as bad as what people keep complaining about, and while i personally didn't approve it, hence why i only gave 5/10, but i could understand why the translator did it. Most of time i only hear what they say instead of reading the translation, so its not a big deal for me.
The biggest example was how Lian teased Nowa a lot in translation, which people falsely claimed that its not happen in JP voice. In fact, it does happen in JP voice too, it just in JP voice, she teased Nowa with her voice tone. Most of time she talk to Nowa, she use a voice tone to talk against someone below her/far younger that her, but its in friendly fun way, not as an insult. As it was a voice tone, a mere translation text won't be able convey it, so the translator add some new teasing. People should know that this is not only text to text translation, it got Seiyuu voice too. Check their voice tone too instead of directly translating it. The translation didn't change the character personality nor the story.
4. Gameplay 10/10: The same old turn base RPG like Suikoden, Combo attack, Rune Magic, etc. The additional battle gameplay with gimmick was interesting too. It seems no [strike]missable recruitment either[/strike] after playing till the end, looks like at least [spoiler]Leene[/spoiler] was missable, making it easier for me to play with my own pace. But even if its got missable character like Suikoden, i wouldn't mind too much. You guys gave a NG+ in here after all. Its not like i need to start from 0 again if i missed something. Also the townbuilding. Unlike Suikoden which the castle automatically get bigger after you recruited more character, this one need to getting materials and upgrade it manually, it make me feel more involved in the town building.
5. Mini-games 10/10 : 
-Fishing minigame make me feel like i playing fishing in Rune Factory game, the setup are similar. 
-For the Beigoma, [spoiler] First character got introduced for this, i was thinking "Why we got Yu-Gi-Oh character in here?", and then when picking the first Beigoma, "Why it feel like choosing a new Pokemon?" [/spoiler], kind of wish there is an option to upgrade / increase Beigoma level. 
-The Card game, It was more fun than what i thought when i see it in the trailer. Not hard to do either once you get use to the game.
- Eggfoot racing : Raising and breeding those Eggfoot for the race was fun, kind of wish the Eggfoot parent won't disappear when we breed them, but i guess that would make the minigame became too easy. Also kind of wish there is no race limit for the Eggfoot, forcing us to keep breeding them even after we make the ultimate Eggfoot.
- Theater : Its fun but also hard at the same time to find the right combination for getting the highest score, need to pick the right one from 120 characters after all. Also, i think it would be more nice if there is additional dialogue for a specific character combination.
- Cooking : Same like the old Suikoden 2 Cooking mini game, it was fun to play and see the judges reaction for some of the food, but its very hard to get good score for all of the judges.
6. Graphic 10/10 : The character design, map, town, etc game Suikoden vibe. It is a nice good looking graphics.

There is only 1 thing i don't like. That we cannot give the castle name manually. I have the castle name that i have been used for a long time in Suikoden series. But now, i cannot use it since the game forced me to pick from the available name.

Yoshitaka Murayama passed away on my birthday. When the news struck, I cried. He was the creator of my favorite game, Suikoden ii. That game means the world to me. He is the reason why I play JRPGs and I am forever grateful to him. It brings me so much joy that I am able to play Eiyuden, an ode to the first two Suikoden games of the series. Most of the characters and parts of the story feels familiar which puts a smile on my face. I feel as if I am reliving my childhood once more and its a dream come true. I do enjoy the game as its own thing too. Rest in peace and thank you for everything.

Eiyuden Chronicle: Hundred Heroes is a prime example of why turn-based JRPG is its own genre. Story, gameplay, animation, optimization and soundtrack are crafted with intricate passion. This game has EVERYTHING the genre could offer. Worth every single rupiah. They don't mess around with the lore and world building aspect of this game either. You'll know what I'm talking about if you play Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising before. They lay it out on you in a way that it won't make you feel overwhelmed and that gives you a lot of freedom to do anything at your own pace. Congratulations to all party involved in the making of this masterpiece and I don't throw that word around casually. I'm trying to keep it cool but I'm so overjoyed right now! Rabbit & Bear Studios, I salute you!

現状49/100点でギリギリおすすめできないレベルです。

クラファン開始の初日に支援したバッカーですが、とにかくUI・システム・シナリオ（のノリ）が古い、想定以上に古い。
古き良き時代のアレを超えた古さで、不便さ・イライラを感じるレベルで最初は強い拒否感がありました。


しかし人間は慣れるもので、謎のウェイト、デフォで装備を売る設定、インベントリの少なさ、単調なバトル、セリフ自動送りでNPCの会話が読めない等は、そういうもんだと思えるようになってきます。とりあえず15時間ほどは遊んでみました。


が、とにかくエンカウント率が低く（1分あるいて1回）、レベルが上がらない。
敵との戦闘でレベル補正がかな～～～～り大きいため、「レベル上げ」が必至なのですが、これにかなりの時間が取られます。
これほんとなんとかしてほしい。

また「おまかせバトル」では回復行動を設定してないにも関わらず、なぜか勝手にやくそう・復活薬を使ってくれるので、ダンジョンを普通に歩くとボス戦で在庫がなくなってます。

そういうバランス調整なんだろうか・・・おかしいよ。

さらにはおまかせバトル中にメンバーのHP・MPが一切確認できない。
マニュアルプレイでも画面外で攻撃食らってるケースが有り、ダメージ確認できなかったり・・・何だこれが多い。


シナリオもすごくスローに進んでいきます。序盤5、6時間程度で物語が大きく動き始めようとしますが、主人公にやる気があまりやる気をみせず、なすがままに進んでいく1本道ストーリーで、そこからさらに10時間程度やりましたが、盛り上がってるようにみせて盛り上がってないという。
仲間探しはフリーといいつつも行動エリアはかなり狭く制限されており、自由度はかなり低いです。

ルーン（スキル）も自由につけ外しできるということだが、剣士系は剣士系という感じで元のクラスの系統ごとに制限があり、固有スキルでも枠は取られちゃうので、こちらも自由度はないに等しい。

拠点にしても拡張に必須の英雄が存在するおかげで、こちらも拡張の自由度はない。

釣りやベーゴマ、演劇といったミニゲームは最序盤から匂わせているものの、なかなか開放されない。


開発陣いわく「自分でどうやって快適にしていくかを考え、拡張することで遊びやすさが上がっていく。」ということだが・・・
例えば移動速度アップについて言うと、アクセサリーを装備することで移動速度が上がるものがあります。

これはパーティメンバーの誰かが装備していれば効果を発揮しますが・・・イベントでちょくちょく主人公だけだったり、二人っきりだったりということがあるんですよね。
別のメンバーに装備させていた場合、そのたびに移動速度は下がります！！

だからといって主人公に装備させるとなると・・・1枠しかない貴重なアクセ枠でステータスアップができない。
つまりはレベル補正（つまりはステータス補正）がデカいゲームなので、戦力がかなり下がることに・・・。


こういうのが良いんだという方もいるでしょうが、あの頃出てたならまだしも、自分的にはギリギリなしかな～。

当時の物を当時のまま現代に持ってこられても困る・・・というのが正直なところ。
面白くないわけじゃないんだけど、アップデート待ってからでいいな～、という感想。
（まあその頃には存在を忘れ去っていそう・・・）
好玩，就是感觉这种画质优化好像不太好，风扇嘎嘎转

Eiyuden Chronicles: Hundred Heroes ist ein wahr gewordener Traum für Liebhaber klassischer JRPGs und ein eindrucksvolles Zeugnis für die Leidenschaft und Hingabe seiner Entwickler. Als Fan von Spielen wie Suikoden habe ich mich seit Jahren nach einem spirituellen Nachfolger gesehnt, und Eiyuden Chronicles erfüllt diese Erwartungen mit Bravour.

Die Grafik, die von handgezeichneten 2D-Sprites bis hin zu detaillierten Umgebungen reicht, ist eine Augenweide und vermittelt eine charmante Nostalgie, während sie gleichzeitig modernen Standards gerecht wird. Die Musik, komponiert von hochtalentierten Künstlern, fängt die Atmosphäre jeder Szene perfekt ein und trägt dazu bei, eine tiefgreifende emotionale Bindung zum Spiel aufzubauen.

Die Geschichte von Eiyuden Chronicles entfaltet sich auf fesselnde Weise und präsentiert eine Vielzahl von faszinierenden Charakteren, von denen jeder eine eigene Geschichte und Motivation hat. Das Gameplay ist ein raffinierter Mix aus rundenbasierten Kämpfen, strategischem Basismanagement und einer Vielzahl von Nebenaktivitäten, die es schwer machen, sich vom Bildschirm loszureißen.

Was dieses Spiel wirklich auszeichnet, ist jedoch die Liebe zum Detail und die Wertschätzung für die Traditionen des Genres. Von kleinen Anspielungen auf vergangene Klassiker bis hin zu innovativen Gameplay-Mechaniken, die das Genre vorantreiben, ist Eiyuden Chronicles ein Liebesbrief an JRPG-Fans weltweit.

Insgesamt kann ich Eiyuden Chronicles: Hundred Heroes uneingeschränkt empfehlen. Es ist nicht nur ein fantastisches Spiel für alteingesessene Fans klassischer JRPGs, sondern auch ein beeindruckendes Werk, das neue Spieler in seinen Bann ziehen wird. Ein absolutes Muss für jeden, der die Magie der goldenen Ära der Rollenspiele erleben möchte.

I played Suikoden II back when this game was announced, as I'd heard a lot of great things about it, so I was definitely curious. In anticipation of this game, I have also played the spin-off Eiyuden Chronicle: Rising, which was pretty mind-numbing, and something I pushed myself through as quickly as possible. 

I'm not a backer, but I have been an interested lurker throughout the games' development.

I apologize in advance for a pretty negative review. In general, I'm actually mid to positive on the game (unfortunately Steam doesn't allow a neutral review), but there's definitely a feeling of a death by a thousand cuts here. Lots of little annoyances and frustrations add up, which has led to my current outlook.

I don't hate it, I just wish it lived up to my expectations more. I wanted an enhanced, modernized, and improved Suikoden experience. Instead, I just got a Suikoden experience. That might be exactly what some people want, but it's not what I wanted.

At times, the game is great, but most of the time, it's very mid. I can't recommend it at full price unless you've specifically played similar titles and want more (quite literally, more of the same). If that isn't you, then I'd really recommend waiting for a sale.

[h3]The Bad:[/h3]

This is a list of things that are needed to improve the game:

- Better English translation (sometimes it's not even close to the Japanese dub and left me wondering if the translation team would have preferred to be the writing team with the liberties they're taking)

- Graphically, the sprites are great, but don't fit in the 3D world whatsoever. In general, the 3D world has very minimal detail and is very sparse at best. It's just not fantastical whatsoever. There's a moment where you cross over a rope bridge between two canyons and I sat back expecting a wide camera shot to show off the environment and... nothing. Blurry blobs in the background that are rough mountains. No vista, no nothing. During set pieces there is an artistic vision, but that vision is not shared with the other 99% of the experience

- Monsters/bosses are not pixel sprites and lead to this weird clashing of art styles. I don't inherently prefer sprites to 3D, but please just pick one as the art director and stick with it, then everything would just gel better. I am a huge fan of the Octopath Traveller series, though, so perhaps I'm spoiled in that sense (Team Asano are incredible)

- The quasi open-world elements are empty and tedious to run through

- There is no sprint button, you have to dungeon delve for an equippable item that boosts run speed. Why? There's a button for walking, though...

- Battles need to move faster. For random encounters, it's largely a one hit-KO deal, but you'll be there for close to a minute regardless

- Button inputs need to be accepted faster (menu scrolling is a delayed nightmare, as is spamming 'attack' in battle)

- No main character avatars are present during the 'war' battles, instead replaced with generic character models that come from the early 2000s (it almost looks like I'm playing The Settlers 2 HD). At times, you will see a speech bubble from a recruited hero, but it's just so basic that it leaves you frustrated that there isn't more

- The war battles are slow, need a fast-forward option, and really aren't that fun whatsoever. They were interesting in Suikoden II, and I was expecting more, and I wanted a true evolution because it's a really cool mechanic! Unfortunately, they were just underwhelming to the point of almost being embarrassing. They could be removed entirely, and we won't have lost anything (perhaps we would have gained elsewhere as a result)

- The menu buttons are inconsistent. Sometimes, you can press the back button, and it'll exit a prompt, other times you won't be allowed to do that and have to press a specific button instead

- Pacing. There are times when I'm having lots of fun and then the game will jackknife into hours long sections that are incredibly slow and dull. After the initial HQ you have three routes to explore, all of which have an NPC 1/5th of the way in saying you can't progress any further. Why??? What's the point in having an open-world if I can't go off and explore? 

- Some heroes are incredibly annoying, but you'll be stuck with them for several hours because you need them to fill a specific role

- It's not always clear what range a character has, or why. So you'll often blindly experiment, hoping for the best. I don't see why we can't change formation mid-battle either

- Healers are effectively pointless. With such large MP costs for healing, you feel like you need to horde MP for boss battles - but then when you do, you'll quickly find that after 2-3 casts you're spent. Not to mention, there's really no use for offensive magic. Well, back to spamming items then...

- Except that you have an inventory limit. Because you have such limited healing ability, you'll find that even with maxed healing items you'll be running on fumes by the end of a dungeon, limping your way through. It's just as well the random encounters are weirdly timed

- Character designs are voices are incredibly mismatched at times, it's actually kind of impressive how wide this gap can be

- Scripted sections will occasionally have you follow this pattern: talk > awkwardly run > battle > talk > player manually runs > talk > battle > repeat 4-5 times. I appreciate it's to give me time to heal, but it breaks the tension immediately, and really just serves to highlight that they know healing is a gameplay issue and as such, solve it by giving you a break after every scripted encounter

- Occasionally you'll get weird audio artefacts. One character voice will be far louder than another, then another will suddenly have way more bass than their previous line. Or you'll get the music not fading out correctly when moving between one area to another

- Character speeds are often far lower than enemies. This means that you might get one attack off before they hit you. Except that enemies often attack in rows or columns, so one random encounter can brutally punish you just for existing

[h3]The Good:[/h3]

Okay, that was a lot of bad. Here's some good:

- The music is mostly great, the big scenes hit well, and the dungeon themes are surprisingly dynamic and interesting

- Boss battles are mostly interesting, though do suffer a bit from being damage sponges. There are 'gimmicks' (what an awful, awful naming convention by the way, why aren't they called tactics?) that are boss-specific environmental systems/attacks. They can at times be a chance-based system too, which gets annoying, but overall if the pace was quickened they'd be great

- The battle system in general is great. The camera (when it works) is really dynamic and gives it a sense of fluidity. I'm hoping it gets more tactical/strategic later on with more character combinations and abilities

- The story is quite interesting so far. When the writing is good, it's great

If you played any Suikoden game before, you know what to expect from this.
Style is nice and quite close to Suikoden 2 in my opinion. Music is also good in my opinion.

Combat feels good with normal difficulty. Not too hard and not too easy. Of course depends on how you play but over-leveling is quite hard because you get less exp the higher level your characters are. Low level character also get more exp from harder fights so it makes it nice for using different characters and combinations. 
There have been grievances for encounter rate but for me it is okay considering that you eventually have to search party members here and there.

War-Combat seems pretty interesting and visually pleasing for me at least. Hard to say anything more yet.

There has only been one bug that prevented doing anything but haven't occured again yet. Frequent saving is recommended because auto-save is not reliable enough.

Menu currently has a problem that makes it seem game freezing but seem to be more a issue of check when menu is closed and allowing game to proceed. For example when you open menu and close it again you can start moving before menu is fully closed and during this time camera is not updating the movement so there is a small teleporting effect. Same happens with conversation bubbles when talking to townspeople and at shops.

My biggest grievance is with localization because you can notice with Japanese voice-over and English text that there are additions of text that might not fit the character or situation. 
->Note that in my 3 hour experience it didn't feel that bad but it was still noticeable. I switched language to Japanese text and voice-over and for me it has been more natural with dialog and text as comparison to previous.
So if you play in English, it might be better to start with English voice-over and text to avoid disparency.

众筹用户，在苦等4年，经历了延期、进XGP、众筹用户不如狗、运费要加钱等一系列骚操作之后。
总算等到游戏本体给发货了。然而PS5实体版亚洲用户最后一批发，还是从美国发货，美国人本地人都玩了半个月玩腻了。这价格和时间成本，远不如直接本地预购。
和客服扯一顿总算是拿到了一个steam版激活码尝鲜，还不带DLC就是了。

闲话抱怨说完，说一下目前游戏前期的体验。
本作作为《幻想水浒传1&2》精神续作，像素风格，一百多个可加入队友，战斗前后排的设计，符文和和合作攻击，战术设置等老系统都有。还有一些小游戏和详细的帮助提示。
语音和对话比较多，虽然这么多人不可能全程语音，但对于各种人物组合都单独设计了语音和内容，不容易，所以导致游戏容量也很大。

但是也就仅此而已了，很难想象一个2024年的游戏还搞这么多限制玩家的设计。
1. 不能随时存档，甚至在城镇和大地图都不行，自动存档从迷宫入口开始。
2. 野外没有回复点，升级也没有回复。草药性价比极高，建议能多买则多买。
3. 踩地雷式遇敌，虽然普通难度下频率很低，但如果你想刻意练级或者弹尽粮绝急于撤退就很麻烦。（听说是高刷新率下遇敌率会降低，就很离谱）
4. 阵亡队友无法获取经验，我估计之后队友多了之后板凳队员也不太方便获取经验。
5. （目前看来）没有快速移动，战斗动画无法跳过。导致你大部分时候都在跑路和看战斗动画。
如果只是难度很高倒还好，但他又不是rogue和魂游戏。
6. 背包有数量限制，图鉴貌似也不能随时查看。
7. 各种可错过内容，影响成就获取。
8. 完全不支持鼠标操作，只能键盘或者手柄，键盘键位很不舒服也改不了（估计按主机平台设计的，对于手柄玩家来说倒也还好。
9. 还有纯随机战斗模式boss，导致你需要纯碰运气，或者练级碾压，而不能靠技术打过去，对于不喜欢练级的玩家来说很有挫败感。
等等……

本来当年幻水主打的就是剧情和一个人多，系统不算好的，更何况之后的幻水3已经做成3D了。在如今手游的天下，这么一个停滞不前的符合刻板印象的单机JRPG，除了怀旧玩家和媒体会吹捧以外，很难吸收新鲜血液。对于单机游戏发展毫无意义。

其他和上个月的支持者封测感觉基本没太大区别，存档也能直接读取，存档槽位从10个变成了20个。
中文翻译一般般，还需要持续优化。

This game is one I have really enjoyed, and I’ve barely scratched the surface of what I can do. I am really loving the game and the effort that was put into it by the amazing team at Rabbit and Bear Studios. If you are an old school JRPG fan, or just a fan of good games in general, give this one a shot. I hope you won’t be disappointed.
